summary.title: Smart Grid Threat Model
summary.description: The system is a combination of a communication, power and co simulator to simulate the power grid over middle and lower voltage.

diagrams.title: Initial Threat Analysis

data.name: External Interface Boundary
data.description: Trennt smart grid eigene Geraete und System von externen Entitaeten.

data.name: SMGW
data.description: Erfasst Zaehlerdaten, verpackt sie als InfoReports und steuert ueber ControlMessages Hausanschlussgeraete

threats.title: insider privilege abuse
threats.description: an insider (authorized user like an empoyee, contractor or third party) can push an update in order to insert either a backdoor or grand privileges to unauthorized people. they can also take control of the network for malicious purposes or personal gain.
threats.mitigation:
- least privilege
- behavioral monitoring
- strict contractor vetting
- secure remote access
- seperation of duties
- strong authentication
- logging and audit trials
- vendor and contractor vetting
 rbac

threats.title: Supply Chain Attack
threats.description: Compromised components introduced through different organizational domains. The attacker forcuses on the integrity and trustworthyness of hardware,software, firmware and third-party services before they are deployed. When these devices are deployed the attack gains access to the smart grid and can issue malicious commands, gain sensitive data or generally dirupt the system.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor risk assessments
- Secure software/firmware supply chain
- Code signing and verification
- Secure boot
- Continuous monitoring and logging
- Zero trust supply chain model
- Incident reports
- Network segmentation

threats.title: GPS Spoofing
threats.description: GPS spoofing is the threat in which the attacker manipulates the GPS signals to disrupt time-stamped data, event ordering or grid protection logic.
threats.mitigation:
- Multi-source time synchronization
- GPS/GNSS signal authentication
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Redundancy
- Cryptographic protection via encrypted connections and signatures

threats.title: Falsifying Log
threats.description: Falsifying security event logs or other logs to cover attack traces or mislead operators.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Least Privilege
- Alerting on log modification
- Time synchronization

threats.title: Privacy Leakage via Smart Meter Data
threats.description: A third party or otherwise compromised IoT device can leak information about the grid or customer information, leading to a privacy degredation.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- network segmentation
- privacy-preserving data aggregation
- TLS 1.3
- Anonymization (differential privacy) and aggregation
- Access control
- IDS

data.name: VNB-SCADA
data.description: Das Supervisory Control and Data Aquisition (SCADA) ist ein Leitsystem des Verteilnetzbetreibers fuer Smart-Meter-Daten und CLS-Steuerung (Load-/Generation-Commands). Es ist fuer hihg-level Ueberwachung und Kontrolle von Geraeten, Prozessen und Distributed Control Systems.

threats.title: Social Engineering
threats.description: Targeting operational personnel to gain access to critical systems, confidential information or perform actions that compromise the security of the smart grid. This is often done thorugh phishing, pretexting or impersonation, manipulation of support or help staff or in-person social engineering at substations or control centers.
threats.mitigation:
- Security Trainings
- Quick reaction to security attacks
- Multi-factor authentication
- RBAC with least privilege
- Audit trails and behavioral monitoring
- Simulated social engineering tests
- Incident reports

threats.title: Insider Privilege Abuse
threats.description: An insider (authorized user like an empoyee, contractor or third party) can push an update in order to insert either a backdoor or grand privileges to unauthorized people. They can also take control of the network for malicious purposes or personal gain.
threats.mitigation:
- Least privilege
- Behavioral monitoring
- Strict contractor vetting
- Secure remote access
- Seperation of Duties
- Strong authentication
- Logging and audit trials
- Vendor and contractor vetting
 RBAC

data.name: Command Frame
data.description: Control Frame, diese bestehen aus Start/Stop Transmissions, Fragen ueber Konfigurationen oder Header Informationen, Control Commands an bestimmt PMUs und die Anfrage von historischen PMU Daten.

threats.title: Insider Privilege Abuse
threats.description: An insider (authorized user like an empoyee, contractor or third party) can push an update in order to insert either a backdoor or grand privileges to unauthorized people. They can also take control of the network for malicious purposes or personal gain.
threats.mitigation:
- Least privilege
- Behavioral monitoring
- Strict contractor vetting
- Secure remote access
- Seperation of Duties
- Strong authentication
- Logging and audit trials
- Vendor and contractor vetting
 RBAC

threats.title: Protection System Bypass
threats.description: Disabling, manipulating or evading protective relays and monitoring systems, suchg as GOOSE-Trip.
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (MFA, certificates)
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Input validation and whitelisting
- Cryptographic integrity
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Disabling of legacy protocols
- Redundant and diverse protection paths
- Fail-safe or watchdog
- Comprehensive logging

threats.title: Falsifying Log
threats.description: Falsifying security event logs or other logs to cover attack traces or mislead operators.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Least Privilege
- Alerting on log modification
- Time synchronization

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering
threats.description: Affecting coordination between protection systems and control centers by altering or manipulating timestamps asccociated with data, commands or logs. This is done to either bypass security controls, hide malicious activity or disrupt synchronization and sequencing in critical systems.
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies
- Secure time synchronization protocols (network time protocol (NTP) with authentication or precision time protocol (PTP))
- TLS 1.3
- Strong authentication
- File integrity checks

threats.title: Communication Protocol Downgrade
threats.description: Forcing systems to use weaker communication protocols, for example downgrade from TLS 1.3 to TLS 1.0.
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network segmentation
- Protocol version pinning

threats.title: Exploit Vulnerable Protocols
threats.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in DNP3, GOOSE over IEC 61850, MMS over IEC 61850, and IEC 60850-5-104
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.title: IoT Botnet Participation
threats.description: An IoT device is compromised and part of a botnet, which leads to ignored control commands, false data injection and/or control sequence injection. They can also be used to send spam, extend the botnet or perform a DoS or DDoS attack.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure onboarding and lifecycle
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: Rogue Device Injection
threats.description: Entering a third party device that porpusfully inserts false data or ignores control commands. Furthermore, it can impersonate legitimite equipment, collect sensitive data or be a foothold for further attacks.
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (TLS 1.3) 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Role-based access control
- CRL

threats.title: Unauthorized Voltage Setpoint Change
threats.description: Adversaries manipulate voltage setpoints in real-time via compromised micro-controllers, causing equipment damage or cascading outages.
threats.mitigation:
- Role-based access control
- Strong Authentication (MFA)
- Command Validation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- End-to-End encryption (TLS 1.3)
- Redundancy and fallback
- Disable legacy protocols

threats.title: Command Injection
threats.description: Inserting malicious control commands into legitimate communication streams
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (MFA, certificates)
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Input validation and whitelisting
- TLS 1.3 and ceritificate pinning (IEC 62351-3)
- Parameterized Commands (structured data formats)
- Secure Boot

threats.title: Replay Attack
threats.description: Replaying legitimate control commands at inappropriate times
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network Segmentation
- Anomaly Detection

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle
threats.description: Intercepting certificate validation traffic to enable impersonation attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce certificate pinning
 - strict TLS validation
- Use HSTS and OCSP stapling
 - Regular Key Rotation
 Network segmentation

data.name: Data Frame
data.description: Synchrophasor Data Frame, der daraus besteht dass dort Phasorgroessen (U/I, Frequenz, ROCOF) enthalten sind. Dazu kommen noch Antworten auf Anfragen vom WAMS-Backend.
data.protocol: IEC 61850-GOOSE TLS-getunnelt, IEC 61850 over IEC 62351-3 TLS

threats.title: False Data Injection
threats.description: Manipulating sent sensor readings from smart meters, PMUs, Protected-IEDs and other sources to cause incorrect state estimation, mask faults, trigger false control actions and evade anomaly detection.
threats.mitigation:
- End-to-end encryption (TLS 1.3) and digital signatures on all data flows (CMS)
- Anomaly detection and cross-validation with redundant data sources
 - Redundant measurements
 - network isolation

threats.title: GPS Spoofing
threats.description: GPS spoofing is the threat in which the attacker manipulates the GPS signals to disrupt time-stamped data, event ordering or grid protection logic.
threats.mitigation:
- Multi-source time synchronization
- GPS/GNSS signal authentication
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Redundancy
- Cryptographic protection via encrypted connections and signatures

threats.title: Traffic Analysis
threats.description: Inferring operational patterns and vulnerabilities through network traffic observation. For this the attacker observes device or user activity schedules, command or event frequency, grid load charges and/or critical infrastructure locations or routines.
threats.mitigation:
- Use strong encryption (TLS 1.3/IPsec) for all data in transit
- Regular key rotation and management
- Network segmentation
- Abnomaliry detection (IDS)

threats.title: Backdoored Firmware
threats.description: Backdoored firmware in field devices (e.g., smart meters or protection relays) enables persistent access.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor Risk Assesment
- Code Signing & Verification (CMS)
- Secure Boot
- Ongoing Code Scanning
- Zero Trust Supply Chain Model
- Limited Access Privileges
- Regular Patching/Updating

data.name: Aggregated InfoReports
data.description: Das SCADA System sendet eine aggregierte Sammlung an InfoReports von den SMGWs an das DSO-DMS, um die wichtigen Telemetriedaten weiterzureichen. Dabei ist eine real-time Ueberwachung nicht vorgegeben, weshalb es in Batches versendet wird.

threats.title: SCADA Operational data
threats.description: Altering operational data flowing to DSO-DMS systems, to manipulate grid operations, evade detection, cuase physical damage and/or mask faults.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation between IT and OT
- Strict firewall rules
- Validate with redundant sources
 - Digital Signatures (CMS)
- Connection via TLS 1.3

threats.title: Alarm Reduction
threats.description: Der Angreifer faengt den Alarm ab und aendert oder loescht ihn, sodass das SCADA System oder der Operator die falschen Aktionen in die Wege leitet. This also includes event notifications.
threats.mitigation:
- Send Acknowledgement
- TLS 1.3 and CMS signed communication
- Cross validation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure logging
- RBAC
- Operator training

- Input validation
- Monitoring
- Rate limiting
- RBAC

threats.title: Fingerprinting
threats.description: Fingerprinting is an information diclosure attack, where an adversary sends specific requests to a system to gather information about its configuration, version, protocols, or internal structure. This allows an attacker to form other attacks and increase its successrate based on the gained information.
threats.mitigation:
- Restrict information disclosure (obfuscate certain information)
- Disable legacy protrocols and unnecessary services 
- Network segmentation
- IDS
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description: Coordinated attacks against multiple communication nodes simultaneously using the denial of service attack or by utilizing multiple compromised systems to dirupt the communication.
threats.mitigation:
- Rate limiting and traffic filtering
- Redundant network paths and failover
- DDoS mitigation appliances/services
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication
- IDS

threats.title: Lateral Movement
threats.description: Attackers moving laterally across network boundaries
threats.mitigation:
- Zero-trust network architecture
- Micro-segmentation
- least-privilege access
- Strong authentication with MFA
- Intrusion detection

threats.title: Eavesdropping

- Regular key rotation and management
 - Use CMS
 - IDPS
 - Network Segmentation
 - Secure Time Synchronization

threats.title: Credential Compromise

threats.mitigation:

- RBAC with least privilege
- Audit trails and behavioral monitoring

threats.title: Replay Attack
threats.description: Replaying legitimate control commands at inappropriate times
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network Segmentation
- Anomaly Detection

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle
threats.description: Intercepting certificate validation traffic to enable impersonation attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce certificate pinning
 - strict TLS validation
- Use HSTS and OCSP stapling
 - Regular Key Rotation
 Network segmentation

data.name: SCADA-Telemetry/Data
data.description: Strom, Spannung, Alarm, Status als MMS Report, also alle Telemetriedaten die vom SCADA System kommen. Dazu kommen noch Logs und historische Daten vom SCADA System die der Operator gebrauchen kann.

threats.title: Corrupting Telemetry
threats.description: Corrupting telemetry data affecting grid monitoring and control decisions, note that it includes non-malicious causes, which are not included in fdi.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation between it and ot
- Strict firewall rules
- Secure protocol gateways
- Cryptographic integrity (CMS, HMAC)
- IDS
- Secure time sync (IEE 1588 PTP)

threats.title: GPS Spoofing
threats.description: GPS spoofing is the threat in which the attacker manipulates the GPS signals to disrupt time-stamped data, event ordering or grid protection logic.
threats.mitigation:
- Multi-source time synchronization
- GPS/GNSS signal authentication
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Redundancy
- Cryptographic protection via encrypted connections and signatures

threats.title: Compromised Operational Data Store
threats.description: An attacker compromises the Data Store and tampers with the logged data leading to wrong conclusions from historical data and incorrect billing calculation.
threats.mitigation:
- Use of strong mutual TLS authentication for all PKI communications (TSL 1.3)
- Harden and isolate PKI servers
- Regularly auditing and monitoring of certificate status and PKI integrity
- Network segmentation
- Redundancy and cross validation
- Monitoring and logging
- Secure backups and recovery

threats.title: Alarm Reduction
threats.description: Der Angreifer faengt den Alarm ab und aendert oder loescht ihn, sodass das SCADA System oder der Operator die falschen Aktionen in die Wege leitet. This also includes event notifications.
threats.mitigation:
- Send Acknowledgement
- TLS 1.3 and CMS signed communication
- Cross validation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure logging
- RBAC
- Operator training

threats.title: Protection System Bypass
threats.description: Disabling, manipulating or evading protective relays and monitoring systems, suchg as GOOSE-Trip.
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (MFA, certificates)
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Input validation and whitelisting
- Cryptographic integrity
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Disabling of legacy protocols
- Redundant and diverse protection paths
- Fail-safe or watchdog
- Comprehensive logging

threats.title: Blinding Security Monitoring
threats.description: Attackers may attempt to blind security monitoring systems to avoid detection during attacks by disrupting, evading or overloading IDS and SIEM.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Rate limiting
- Access controll and segmentation
- Alert on failure

threats.title: Falsifying Log
threats.description: Falsifying security event logs or other logs to cover attack traces or mislead operators.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Least Privilege
- Alerting on log modification
- Time synchronization

threats.title: Traffic Analysis
threats.description: Inferring operational patterns and vulnerabilities through network traffic observation. For this the attacker observes device or user activity schedules, command or event frequency, grid load charges and/or critical infrastructure locations or routines.
threats.mitigation:
- Use strong encryption (TLS 1.3/IPsec) for all data in transit
- Regular key rotation and management
- Network segmentation
- Abnomaliry detection (IDS)

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering
threats.description: Affecting coordination between protection systems and control centers by altering or manipulating timestamps asccociated with data, commands or logs. This is done to either bypass security controls, hide malicious activity or disrupt synchronization and sequencing in critical systems.
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies
- Secure time synchronization protocols (network time protocol (NTP) with authentication or precision time protocol (PTP))
- TLS 1.3
- Strong authentication
- File integrity checks

threats.title: Communication Protocol Downgrade
threats.description: Forcing systems to use weaker communication protocols, for example downgrade from TLS 1.3 to TLS 1.0.
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network segmentation
- Protocol version pinning

threats.title: Insider Privilege Abuse

threats.mitigation:
- Least privilege
- Behavioral monitoring
- Strict contractor vetting
- Secure remote access
- Seperation of Duties

 RBAC

n- Cryptographic integrity checks (MACs)

- IDS

threats.title: Fingerprinting
threats.description: Fingerprinting is an information diclosure attack, where an adversary sends specific requests to a system to gather information about its configuration, version, protocols, or internal structure. This allows an attacker to form other attacks and increase its successrate based on the gained information.
threats.mitigation:
- Restrict information disclosure (obfuscate certain information)
- Disable legacy protrocols and unnecessary services 
- Network segmentation
- IDS
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: Exploit Vulnerable Protocols
threats.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in DNP3, GOOSE over IEC 61850, MMS over IEC 61850, and IEC 60850-5-104
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.title: Third Party Integration
threats.description: Vulnerabilities in external operator connections becoming entry points
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation and strict inter-domain access controls
- Continuous monitoring of inter-domain traffic
- Security vetting of third-party components

threats.title: Unauthorized Voltage Setpoint Change
threats.description: Adversaries manipulate voltage setpoints in real-time via compromised micro-controllers, causing equipment damage or cascading outages.
threats.mitigation:
- Role-based access control
- Strong Authentication (MFA)
- Command Validation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- End-to-End encryption (TLS 1.3)
- Redundancy and fallback
- Disable legacy protocols

data.name: Meter Values
data.description: Senden von echtzeit Telemetrie daten (P/Q, SOC) als CLS-JSON, sowie Status Meldungen und Error Codes.

threats.title: EVSE-Gateway Compromise
threats.description: Electric vehicle charging infrastructure manipulation affecting grid load balancing
threats.mitigation:
- Secure boot, hardware security modules, and firmware integrity checks
- Regular vulnerability scanning and patch management
- Physical security controls

threats.title: Traffic Analysis
threats.description: Inferring operational patterns and vulnerabilities through network traffic observation. For this the attacker observes device or user activity schedules, command or event frequency, grid load charges and/or critical infrastructure locations or routines.
threats.mitigation:
- Use strong encryption (TLS 1.3/IPsec) for all data in transit
- Regular key rotation and management
- Network segmentation
- Abnomaliry detection (IDS)

threats.title: Microgrid Compromise
threats.description: Manipulation of local energy management and control systems through unauthorized access to the devices or their communication.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure boot
- Regular vulnerability scanning and patch management
- Physical security controls
- Network Segmentation and firewalls with IDS

threats.title: Backdoored Firmware
threats.description: Backdoored firmware in field devices (e.g., smart meters or protection relays) enables persistent access.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor Risk Assesment
- Code Signing & Verification (CMS)
- Secure Boot
- Ongoing Code Scanning
- Zero Trust Supply Chain Model
- Limited Access Privileges
- Regular Patching/Updating

threats.title: Lateral Movement
threats.description: Attackers moving laterally across network boundaries
threats.mitigation:
- Zero-trust network architecture
- Micro-segmentation
- least-privilege access
- Strong authentication with MFA
- Intrusion detection

threats.title: False Data Injection
threats.description: Manipulating sent sensor readings from smart meters, PMUs, Protected-IEDs and other sources to cause incorrect state estimation, mask faults, trigger false control actions and evade anomaly detection.
threats.mitigation:
- End-to-end encryption (TLS 1.3) and digital signatures on all data flows (CMS)
- Anomaly detection and cross-validation with redundant data sources
 - Redundant measurements
 - network isolation

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle
threats.description: Intercepting certificate validation traffic to enable impersonation attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce certificate pinning
 - strict TLS validation
- Use HSTS and OCSP stapling
 - Regular Key Rotation
 Network segmentation

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering
threats.description: Affecting coordination between protection systems and control centers by altering or manipulating timestamps asccociated with data, commands or logs. This is done to either bypass security controls, hide malicious activity or disrupt synchronization and sequencing in critical systems.
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies
- Secure time synchronization protocols (network time protocol (NTP) with authentication or precision time protocol (PTP))
- TLS 1.3
- Strong authentication
- File integrity checks

threats.title: Insider Privilege Abuse
threats.description: An insider (authorized user like an empoyee, contractor or third party) can push an update in order to insert either a backdoor or grand privileges to unauthorized people. They can also take control of the network for malicious purposes or personal gain.
threats.mitigation:
- Least privilege
- Behavioral monitoring
- Strict contractor vetting
- Secure remote access
- Seperation of Duties
- Strong authentication
- Logging and audit trials
- Vendor and contractor vetting
 RBAC

threats.title: Communication Protocol Downgrade
threats.description: Forcing systems to use weaker communication protocols, for example downgrade from TLS 1.3 to TLS 1.0.
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network segmentation
- Protocol version pinning

threats.title: API Abuse
threats.description: An attacker exploits weak authentication, input validation or excessive privileges in exposed APIs to gain unauthorized access, inject malicious data or disrupt the grid operations.
threats.mitigation:
- API security gateways
- Strong authentication (MFA)
- Input validation
- Monitoring
- Rate limiting
- RBAC

threats.title: IoT Botnet Participation
threats.description: An IoT device is compromised and part of a botnet, which leads to ignored control commands, false data injection and/or control sequence injection. They can also be used to send spam, extend the botnet or perform a DoS or DDoS attack.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure onboarding and lifecycle
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: DDoS

threats.mitigation:
- Rate limiting and traffic filtering
- Redundant network paths and failover
- DDoS mitigation appliances/services
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication
- IDS

- TLS 1.3 and ceritificate pinning (IEC 62351-3)
- Parameterized Commands (structured data formats)

threats.title: Replay Attack

- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network Segmentation
- Anomaly Detection

threats.description: Manipulation of local energy management and control systems through unauthorized access to the devices or their communication.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure boot
- Regular vulnerability scanning and patch management
- Physical security controls
- Network Segmentation and firewalls with IDS

threats.description: Virtual Power Plant systems being used as attack vectors into utility networks. From there the attacker can issue malicious commands, manipulate DER registrations, falsify aggregated data or disrupte grid statbility.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication (MFA)
- Strong encryption
- Conitnuous monitoring and intrusion detection (IDS)
- Disable legacy protocols
- Segregation of duties
- Incident reporting
- Supply chain and vendor security

threats.title: Traffic Analysis
threats.description: Inferring operational patterns and vulnerabilities through network traffic observation. For this the attacker observes device or user activity schedules, command or event frequency, grid load charges and/or critical infrastructure locations or routines.
threats.mitigation:
- Use strong encryption (TLS 1.3/IPsec) for all data in transit
- Regular key rotation and management
- Network segmentation
- Abnomaliry detection (IDS)

threats.title: Pricing Signal Manipulation
threats.description: Adversaries falsify dynamic pricing signals sent to DERs or consumers, triggering abrupt load changes that destabilize the grid or manipulate energy markets.
threats.mitigation:
- Digitally sign all pricing/load signals (e.g., using IEC 62351 or OpenADR 3.0).
- Validate signals against redundant sources (e.g., independent market feeds).
- Deploy anomaly detection for abnormal price/load patterns.

threats.title: VPP Operator Compromise

threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication (MFA)
- Strong encryption
- Conitnuous monitoring and intrusion detection (IDS)
- Disable legacy protocols
- Segregation of duties
- Incident reporting
- Supply chain and vendor security

threats.title: Alarm Reduction

threats.mitigation:
- Send Acknowledgement
- TLS 1.3 and CMS signed communication
- Cross validation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure logging
- RBAC

threats.title: Blinding Security Monitoring

threats.mitigation:

- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Rate limiting
- Access controll and segmentation

- Network segmentation

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering

This is done to either bypass security controls, hide malicious activity or disrupt synchronization and sequencing in critical systems.
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies
- Secure time synchronization protocols (network time protocol (NTP) with authentication or precision time protocol (PTP))
- TLS 1.3
- Strong authentication
- File integrity checks

threats.title: Fingerprinting

This allows an attacker to form other attacks and increase its successrate based on the gained information.
threats.mitigation:
- Restrict information disclosure (obfuscate certain information)
- Disable legacy protrocols and unnecessary services 
- Network segmentation
- IDS
- TLS 1.3

- Network segmentation

threats.title: False Data Injection
threats.description: Manipulating sensor readings from PMUs and Protected-IEDs to cause incorrect state estimation
threats.mitigation:
- End-to-end encryption and digital signatures on all data flows
- Anomaly detection and cross-validation with redundant data sources

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering
threats.description: Affecting coordination between protection systems and control centers by altering or manipulating timestamps asccociated with data, commands or logs. This is done to either bypass security controls, hide malicious activity or disrupt synchronization and sequencing in critical systems.
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies
- Secure time synchronization protocols (network time protocol (NTP) with authentication or precision time protocol (PTP))
- TLS 1.3
- Strong authentication
- File integrity checks

threats.title: API Abuse
threats.description: An attacker exploits weak authentication, input validation or excessive privileges in exposed APIs to gain unauthorized access, inject malicious data or disrupt the grid operations.
threats.mitigation:
- API security gateways
- Strong authentication (MFA)
- Input validation
- Monitoring
- Rate limiting
- RBAC

threats.title: Privacy Leakage via Smart Meter Data
threats.description: A third party or otherwise compromised IoT device can leak information about the grid or customer information, leading to a privacy degredation.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- network segmentation
- privacy-preserving data aggregation
- TLS 1.3
- Anonymization (differential privacy) and aggregation
- Access control
- IDS

threats.title: IoT Botnet Participation
threats.description: An IoT device is compromised and part of a botnet, which leads to ignored control commands, false data injection and/or control sequence injection. They can also be used to send spam, extend the botnet or perform a DoS or DDoS attack.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure onboarding and lifecycle
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: Rogue Device Injection
threats.description: Entering a third party device that porpusfully inserts false data or ignores control commands. Furthermore, it can impersonate legitimite equipment, collect sensitive data or be a foothold for further attacks.
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (TLS 1.3) 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Role-based access control
- CRL

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description: Coordinated attacks against multiple communication nodes simultaneously using the denial of service attack or by utilizing multiple compromised systems to dirupt the communication.
threats.mitigation:
- Rate limiting and traffic filtering
- Redundant network paths and failover
- DDoS mitigation appliances/services
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication
- IDS

threats.title: Replay Attack

threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support
- Network Segmentation
- Anomaly Detection

- Backup and Revocery (immutable backups)

threats.title: Fingerprinting
threats.description: Fingerprinting is an information diclosure attack, where an adversary sends specific requests to a system to gather information about its configuration, version, protocols, or internal structure. This allows an attacker to form other attacks and increase its successrate based on the gained information.
threats.mitigation:
- Restrict information disclosure (obfuscate certain information)
- Disable legacy protrocols and unnecessary services 
- Network segmentation
- IDS
- TLS 1.3

threats.mitigation:

- Regular key rotation and management
 - Use CMS
 - IDPS
 - Network Segmentation
 - Secure Time Synchronization

data.name: CRL push/download
data.description: Der OCSP Responder gibt eine Pushnachricht an den CRL-Server, wenn ein Zertifikat wiederrufen wurde und kann gleichzeitig nachfragen und somit auf Anfragen antworten, ob ein gegebenes Zertifikat bereits wiederrufen wurde. Es ist auch moeglich, dass der OCSP-Responder eine aktuelle Version der CRL cached und updated, wenn notwendig.

threats.title: DoS
threats.description: Es werden zu viele Anfragen von einem externen Geraet an den CRL Server gesendet und somit die Verbindung zwischen OCSP Responder und CRL Server gestoert, sodass die CRL nicht abgerufen werden kann und ein Zertifikatswiederrufungscheck nicht moeglich ist.
threats.mitigation:
- Kommunikationslimit pro Geraet
- Redumdance von OCSP Responder und CRL Server

data.description: Trennt Field/edge Geraete von dem Kernnetzwerk und den IoT/IT Geraeten.

data.name: Maintenance/Update Boundary
data.description: Trennt remote maintenance/update server mit deren erhoehten Privilegien von den anderen Geraeten.

data.description: Trennt Utility-managed Infrastruktur mit erhoehten Privilegien von Kunden-Geraeten und Netwerken.

data.name:
Outage 
Management 
System
data.description: System fuer Ausfallermittlung: Polling von Smart Meter Gateways (ANSI C12.22/DLMS) und Auswerten von Responses.

threats.title: Compromised Operational Data Store
threats.description: An attacker compromises the Data Store and tampers with the logged data leading to wrong conclusions from historical data and incorrect billing calculation.
threats.mitigation:
- Use of strong mutual TLS authentication for all PKI communications (TSL 1.3)
- Harden and isolate PKI servers
- Regularly auditing and monitoring of certificate status and PKI integrity
- Network segmentation
- Redundancy and cross validation
- Monitoring and logging
- Secure backups and recovery

threats.title: Ransomeware
threats.description: Encrypting critical operational data and systems to lock out operators until a ransom is payed.
threats.mitigation:
- Redundancy
- Communication Monitoring
- Network Segmentation and zero trust policy
- Regular Patching
- Strong authentication and access control
- Backup and Revocery (immutable backups)
- Endpoint Potection and Monitoring (EDR)

threats.title: Physical Threat
threats.description: The physical threat described the unauthorized access, tampering, vandalism, theft, sabotage, environmental hazards, or destruction of a device or infrastructure in the grid. This is more detailed in the 'Field Communication Infrastructure' actor.
threats.mitigation:
- Permite Survailance 
- Tampering Seals
- Access Control (Keycards etc, Visitor/Maintanance Management)
- Access logging (digitally and physically)
- Lifecycle Security
- Supply chain security
- Regular inspections

data.name: IDS/SIEM
data.description:
Das Intrusion Detection System (IDS) beobachtet ein Netzwerk oder System und gibt ein Alarm aus, wenn es verdaechtige Aktivitaeten bemerkt oder gegen vorgegebene Regeln verstossen wird. 
Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) wiederum sammelt log Data fuer Analysen und alamiert darauf basieren die zustaendigen Einheiten. Dazu kommt noch real-time system monitoring, welches den Systemadmin ueber relevante Probleme informiert und Eventkorrelationen erstellt.
Die beiden Systeme arbeiten meist zusammen, wobei das IDS fuer das eigentlich Monitoring und detektieren von gefaehrlichen Aktivitaeten zustaendig ist und das SIEM daraufhin alamiert wird und passende Aktionen in die Wege leitet.
Empfaengt IDS-Alarme via Syslog, korreliert Security-Events und priorisiert Vorfaelle fuer das Security Operation Center.

threats.title: Blinding Security Monitoring
threats.description: Attackers may attempt to blind security monitoring systems to avoid detection during attacks by disrupting, evading or overloading IDS and SIEM.
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits
- Rate limiting
- Access controll and segmentation
- Alert on failure

threats.title: Ransomeware
threats.description: Encrypting critical operational data and systems to lock out operators until a ransom is payed.
threats.mitigation:
- Redundancy
- Communication Monitoring
- Network Segmentation and zero trust policy
- Regular Patching
- Strong authentication and access control
- Backup and Revocery (immutable backups)
- Endpoint Potection and Monitoring (EDR)

data.name: CRL-Server
data.description:
Stellt Certificate Revocation List (CRLs) bereit, damit Clients die Zertifikatsgueltigkeit pruefen koennen.
Am ende ist es eine Art Datastorage in dem ein Liste an allen gespeicherten Zertifikaten liegt, die vom OCSP-Responder wiederrufen wurden.
Die CRL Dateien wiederum sind signiert vom Certificate Authority via RSA mit SHA 256/512.

threats.title: CRL-Server Compromise
threats.description: Certificate Revocation List tampering can enable the use of compromised certificates. This is done by gaining unauthorized access to the CRL-Server and removing certificates.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication and encryption (RBAC and TLS 1.3)
- Cryptographic signatures (CMS)
- Regular audits and key rotation

data.name: OCSP-Responder
data.description:
Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP): gibt in Echtzeit den Wiederrufstatus von X.509-Zertifikaten aus.
Im Allgemeinen ist es ein certificate manager der fuer die Erstellung, Speicherung und Wiederrufung digitaler Sicherheitszertifikate notwendig ist.

threats.title: CRL-Server Compromise
threats.description: Certificate Revocation List tampering can enable the use of compromised certificates. This is done by gaining unauthorized access to the CRL-Server and removing certificates.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation
- Strong authentication and encryption (RBAC and TLS 1.3)
- Cryptographic signatures (CMS)
- Regular audits and key rotation

threats.title: OCSP Responder Compromise
threats.description: Attackers can manipulate certificate validation responses, to allow them to revoke certificates to appear valid. This can even be done in real-time.
threats.mitigation:
- Use of strong mutual TLS authentication for all PKI communications
- Harden and isolate PKI servers
- Regularly auditing and monitoring of certificate status and PKI integrity
- Certificate pinning and HSTS
 Regualr key rotation
 Strict access control
- Redundancy and integrity checks

data.name: PMU
data.description: Messen von Phasorgroessen (U/I, Frequenz, ROCOF) mit PTP-Zeitstempel und Streaming an WAMS

threats.title: GPS Spoofing
threats.description: GPS spoofing is the threat in which the attacker manipulates the GPS signals to disrupt time-stamped data, event ordering or grid protection logic.
threats.mitigation:
- Multi-source time synchronization
- GPS/GNSS signal authentication
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Redundancy
- Cryptographic protection via encrypted connections and signatures

threats.title: Supply Chain Attack
threats.description: Compromised components introduced through different organizational domains. The attacker forcuses on the integrity and trustworthyness of hardware,software, firmware and third-party services before they are deployed. When these devices are deployed the attack gains access to the smart grid and can issue malicious commands, gain sensitive data or generally dirupt the system.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor risk assessments
- Secure software/firmware supply chain
- Code signing and verification
- Secure boot
- Continuous monitoring and logging
- Zero trust supply chain model
- Incident reports
- Network segmentation

threats.title: Physical Threat
threats.description: The physical threat described the unauthorized access, tampering, vandalism, theft, sabotage, environmental hazards, or destruction of a device or infrastructure in the grid. This is more detailed in the 'Field Communication Infrastructure' actor.
threats.mitigation:
- Permite Survailance 
- Tampering Seals
- Access Control (Keycards etc, Visitor/Maintanance Management)
- Access logging (digitally and physically)
- Lifecycle Security
- Supply chain security
- Regular inspections

data.name: WAMS-Backend
data.description: Das Wide Area Monitoring System (WAMS) sammelt Phasordaten und fungiert als Analyseplattform fuer Wide-Area Monitoring & Protection (WAMPAC, State Estimation). Dabei werden die Daten visualisiert und fuer einen Operator aufbereitet.
data.privilegeLevel: Access to Sensitive Data, Critical Security Role, Full Operational Control

data.name: DSO-DMS
data.description:
Distributed System Operator: Real-Time Grid Operation und Monitoring. Er nutzt das Distribution Management System, um damit Controll Commands anhand der InfoReports und weiteren eingehenden Informationen auszugeben, um die Systemrequirements sicher zu stellen.
Distribution Management System: Netzueberwachung, Lastfluss- und Spannungsregelung, FLISR-Funktionen

threats.title: Social Engineering
threats.description: Targeting operational personnel to gain access to critical systems, confidential information or perform actions that compromise the security of the smart grid. This is often done thorugh phishing, pretexting or impersonation, manipulation of support or help staff or in-person social engineering at substations or control centers.
threats.mitigation:
- Security Trainings
- Quick reaction to security attacks
- Multi-factor authentication
- RBAC with least privilege
- Audit trails and behavioral monitoring
- Simulated social engineering tests
- Incident reports

threats.title: Insider Privilege Abuse
threats.description: An insider (authorized user like an empoyee, contractor or third party) can push an update in order to insert either a backdoor or grand privileges to unauthorized people. They can also take control of the network for malicious purposes or personal gain.
threats.mitigation:
- Least privilege
- Behavioral monitoring
- Strict contractor vetting
- Secure remote access
- Seperation of Duties
- Strong authentication
- Logging and audit trials
- Vendor and contractor vetting
 RBAC

threats.title: Privacy Leakage via Smart Meter Data
threats.description: A third party or otherwise compromised IoT device can leak information about the grid or customer information, leading to a privacy degredation.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- network segmentation
- privacy-preserving data aggregation
- TLS 1.3
- Anonymization (differential privacy) and aggregation
- Access control
- IDS

data.privilegeLevel: Full Operational Control, Access to Sensitive Data, Critical Security Role

data.name: Protected-IED
data.description: Das Protected-IED (Intelligent Electronic Device) Schutzrelais fuer Distanzschutz, Differentialschutz. Wenn ein Fehler bemerkt wird, dann wird ein trip command an die Breaker via GOOSE ausgeloest, um die fehlerhafte Netzzonen zu isolieren. Somit beinhaltet das Protected-IED auch monitoring Funktionen.

threats.title: Fingerprinting
threats.description: Fingerprinting is an information diclosure attack, where an adversary sends specific requests to a system to gather information about its configuration, version, protocols, or internal structure. This allows an attacker to form other attacks and increase its successrate based on the gained information.
threats.mitigation:
- Restrict information disclosure (obfuscate certain information)
- Disable legacy protrocols and unnecessary services 
- Network segmentation
- IDS
- TLS 1.3

data.description: e.g., "Balcony PV," "Home Battery," "Smart Appliances"

threats.title: IoT Botnet Participation
threats.description: An IoT device is compromised and part of a botnet, which leads to ignored control commands, false data injection and/or control sequence injection. They can also be used to send spam, extend the botnet or perform a DoS or DDoS attack.
threats.mitigation:
- Device authentication 
- Network segmentation
- Privacy-preserving data aggregation
- Anomaly detection (IDS)
- Secure onboarding and lifecycle
- TLS 1.3

threats.title: Supply Chain Attack
threats.description: Compromised components introduced through different organizational domains. The attacker forcuses on the integrity and trustworthyness of hardware,software, firmware and third-party services before they are deployed. When these devices are deployed the attack gains access to the smart grid and can issue malicious commands, gain sensitive data or generally dirupt the system.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor risk assessments
- Secure software/firmware supply chain
- Code signing and verification
- Secure boot
- Continuous monitoring and logging
- Zero trust supply chain model
- Incident reports
- Network segmentation

threats.title: Third Party Integration
threats.description: Vulnerabilities in external operator connections becoming entry points. They also open the door for backdoors and supply chain attacks.
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation and strict inter-domain access controls
- Continuous monitoring of inter-domain traffic
- Security vetting of third-party components
- Strong authentication
- Secure Software and Firmware updates
- Information Sharing and Collaboration between power suppliers.

threats.title: Physical Threat
threats.description: The physical threat described the unauthorized access, tampering, vandalism, theft, sabotage, environmental hazards, or destruction of a device or infrastructure in the grid. This is more detailed in the 'Field Communication Infrastructure' actor.
threats.mitigation:
- Permite Survailance 
- Tampering Seals
- Access Control (Keycards etc, Visitor/Maintanance Management)
- Access logging (digitally and physically)
- Lifecycle Security
- Supply chain security
- Regular inspections

threats.title: Ransomeware
threats.description: Encrypting critical operational data and systems to lock out operators until a ransom is payed.
threats.mitigation:
- Redundancy
- Communication Monitoring
- Network Segmentation and zero trust policy
- Regular Patching
- Strong authentication and access control
- Backup and Revocery (immutable backups)
- Endpoint Potection and Monitoring (EDR)

data.name:
Forcasting 
System
data.description: Predicts energy generation (e.g., solar/wind) and load patterns.

data.name: Billing System
data.description: Processes metering data for customer billing and settlement.
data.reasonOutOfScope: We do not have the capacity to also look at the billing process and the different evelope techniques that come with it.

data.name: Field Communication Infrastructure
data.description: Physical communication channels (e.g., fiber optics, power-line communication, wireless links) enabling data transmission between grid components. Vulnerable to physical tampering, environmental damage, and jamming

threats.title: Cable Tampering/Cutting
threats.description: Physical destruction of wired links (e.g., fiber, copper)
threats.mitigation:
- Bury critical cables
- Use tamper-evident conduits
- Deploy seismic/vibration sensors

threats.title: Wireless Jamming
threats.description: Disrupting RF signals (e.g., LTE, Wi-Fi, Zigbee)
threats.mitigation:
- Frequency-hopping spread spectrum
- Wired fallback paths
- Jamming detection systems

threats.title: Device Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized access to routers, switches, or repeaters
threats.mitigation:
- Secure locked enclosures
- Tamper-evident seals
- Remote integrity checks

threats.title: Environmental Hazards
threats.description: Damage from floods, fires, or extreme weather
threats.mitigation:
- Weatherproof enclosures
- Redundant paths
- Environmental monitoring
